meanings.definition: A conductor through which electricity enters or leaves an object.
meanings.sent1: The electrode connected to the battery allowed the electricity to flow into the device.
meanings.sent2: The scientist carefully attached the electrode to the circuit to complete the electrical connection.
meanings.sent3: The electrode was like a gatekeeper, controlling the flow of electricity into the machine.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as electrodes, sparking inspiration in the hearts of her listeners.
meanings.sent5: The electrode hummed with energy, ready to power up the entire system.

meanings.definition: A terminal through which electric current passes between a metal and a liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The electrode in the experiment allowed the electric current to flow between the metal and the liquid.
meanings.sent2: The technician carefully inserted the electrode into the solution to measure the conductivity.
meanings.sent3: The electrode seemed like a bridge connecting the metal and the liquid, allowing them to communicate.
meanings.sent4: His smile acted as an electrode, transmitting positivity to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The electrode sizzled as the electric current surged through it, creating a mesmerizing display.
